name: "Sledgehammer" Ordinance Projector
description: A special grenade launcher which fires multiple grenades at once, all exploding soon after discharge and causing catastrophic damage.
on_attack: Take 10 AP Explosive damage. This damage can't be reduced by Systems or Traits and ignores Immunity.

name: "Chickenhawk" Cluster Dispersal Cannon
description: A notorious weapon in the EDF catalog, notable for its lack of discernment between friend, foe, and "that which must not be destroyed." Its usefulness as crowd control cannot be understated, however, and it's that usefulness that keeps it up as an option for EDF aligned pilots who tend to find themselves in otherwise overwhelming scenarios.

profiles.name: Standard Fire
profiles.effect: This may be fired normally or Point Blank at a Single Target within Threat 1.

profiles.name: Point Blank Single Target
profiles.effect: This may be fired normally or Point Blank at a Single Target within Threat 1.

name: Cradle Pattern Machine Gun
description: While it is called a heavy machine gun, in reality this title is a holdover from when the EDF named weapons in relation to infantry scale weapons. This has lead to many disappointed pilots who believed they would receive an upgrade to the GMS model Heavy Machine Gun, however some pilots have found niche-yet-effective uses for the EDF model.
effect: When you install this weapon, or during a Full Repair, you may choose a new damage type between Explosive, Energy, or Kinetic.

name: "Peony" Anti-Chassis Reusable Launcher
description: The Peony is one among many EDF mech-scale weapons based on an infantry-scale weapon with an overwhelmingly powerful warhead for its size. Normally, even for its limited capacity, the power offered would be an instant sell for demolition teams and launcher fans, however the atrocious accuracy afforded by this weapon has been an annoying sour spot for EDF personnel and licensees alike and resulted in the deaths of nearly 57 troops before it was identified and removed from infantry inventories. Owners of Peony licenses are endlessly warned by EDF personnel and waivers they are exclusively to be used by mechs, where the mech's armor and chassis may act as a safety barrier between the user and the warhead should it fail to fire in the direction it was aimed.
on_attack: Roll a d6. On a 1, this weapon's attack's target immediately changes to the space you currently occupy and you gain +2 accuracy on this attack.
on_hit: Characters hit by this are knocked Prone. If they are Prone, they are Stunned until the end of their next turn.

name: "Hermes" Pattern Coil Gun
description: Hermes Pattern coil guns are a straightforward set of guns known and respected by many EDF troops and licensees for their reliable and simple nature. While the vehicles that debuted with them were wild and unwieldy and made aiming a nightmare, mechs proved to be a stable and calming platform for even newbie pilots looking for a relatively powerful-if-limited weapon. However, due to a licensing lawsuit related to the Peony, licensing restrictions on Hermes, the Sledgehammer, and Strafing Drone weapons were harshly tightened up.

name: Erebus Missile Launcher
description: A high-performance multi-barrel missile launch system, it fires large volleys of missiles at individually locked targets, instead of the typical practice of firing clusters of missiles at a single target. While this hinders its single-target potential, its group damage potential is undeniable.
effect: This weapon may attack up to three targets at a time.

name: Typhoon-Class Autoloading Howitzer
description: While the Typhoon was purpose-made for the EDF's Thales design, popular demand is ultimately what made this weapon be released as a standalone product. Its rapid fire and rarely-matched destructive force lets it shine in spite of how difficult it is to aim with how much smoke it lets off when it fires.
effect: By spending one limited charge, this weapon can attack up to four times, either targeting different targets or the same target each time.

name: MISSILE Missiles
description: Multiple Intercept Social Sprayed Intelligent Linear Ejection Missiles were one of the EDF's many infantry-scale weapon offshoots. Mounting several High Altitude Indirect Launch missile tubes into a single box and mounting it forwards, this endeavor proved to be a massive success as each group of missiles was able to communicate between itself without causing interference among each other. However, it was struck down in that form by ongoing lawsuits relating to autonomous drones. To avoid feeding into that issue, the EDF simplified the intelligence of the launcher to only target a single point chosen by the pilot. While the suit was ultimately dropped, the weapon was not returned to its original form to avoid any unnecessary attention.

name: Torchlight Mk 64 ASM Chute-Guide Multisystem
description: One of many infantry-scale weapons adapted for mech-to-mech combat, the Torchlight is a Gauss Mainstay reconfigured to be fired out of launch tubes on a mech. While traditional use requires both an Air Raider to provide a lock and a Gauss to provide the munition, mech scale Torchlights handle both roles at once with a mid-power laser tuned to the specific frequency the launcher is configured to look for, so as to not interfere with other Torchlight anti-ship missiles already in flight. While this does prevent them from interfacing with other laser guide kits, it ultimately improves target distribution.

profiles.name: Fire Torchlight
profiles.effect: You may use either the Laser Designate or Fire Levi weapon profile, but only one each turn.
profiles.on_attack: When this weapon is fired, designate a target space within Range 10 or Sensors, whichever is greater. This weapon then deploys the Levi missile to a space adjacent to you. At the start of each of your subsequent turns, the missile flies 3 spaces towards the target. The missile moves as directly as possible, but only in a straight line decided by you each turn, until it arrives at the target point or collides with an obstruction or character it detonates with a Burst 2 explosion. Characters within the affected area must make an Agility save. On fail, they take 3d6+12 Explosive damage; on success, they take half damage.

deployables.name: Torchlight Anti-Ship Missile
deployables.detail: At the start of each of your subsequent turns after the Torchlight Anti-Ship Missile is deployed, the missile flies 3 spaces towards the target. The missile moves as directly as possible, but only in a straight line decided by you each turn, until it arrives at the target point or collides with an obstruction or character it detonates with a Burst 2 explosion. Characters within the affected area must make an Agility save. On fail, they take 3d6+12 Explosive damage; on success, they take half damage.

profiles.name: Laser Designate
profiles.effect:
This weapon's range is either Range 10 or your Sensors, whichever is greater.
You may fire this weapon using the Laser Designate profile as a skirmish.
profiles.on_attack: Change the target point all currently active Torchlight Anti-Ship Missiles you have fired are seeking to the targeted point.
profiles.on_hit: Choose a space the target character occupies; this space becomes the target point all currently active Levi Missiles you have fired are seeking.

name: Point Defense Blaster
description: A turret-mounted gun capable of engaging enemies that might give normal guns more trouble. The additional joints built into the gun allow it to keep up with targets independently of the mech as a whole.
effect: This weapon ignores ranged penalties from Engaged.

name: Gaussian Blade
description: A powerful blade that uses energy generated from the vibration of an internal motor to produce a forcefield that is launched from the blade when swung. While not as destructive as many EDF weapons, its lethality is rivaled by few other weapons among the many catalogs available to pilots.

profiles.name: Regular Attack
profiles.effect:
You may only take one protocol from this weapon each round.
As a protocol or quick action, you may charge the Gaussian Blade to its high voltage state.
This weapon must attack using this profile if it has no charge state.
This weapon may be used to overwatch 2/round

actions.name: Charge Gaussian Blade
actions.detail: Charge the Gaussian Blade, immediately putting it into a charged state and allowing it to use the "High Voltage" profile.

actions.name: Charge Gaussian Blade
actions.detail: Charge the Gaussian Blade, immediately putting it into a charged state and allowing it to use the "High Voltage" profile.

profiles.name: High Voltage
profiles.effect:
You may only take one protocol from this weapon each round.
As a protocol or quick action, you may charge the Gaussian Blade to its maximum state.
This weapon must attack using its current charge state profile.
When this weapon attacks using its High Voltage profile, it immediately loses its charged state.
This weapon may be used to overwatch 2/round

actions.name: Maximize Charge
actions.detail: The weapon enters its max charged state, immediately allowing it to use its Maximum profile.

actions.name: Maximize Charge
actions.detail: The weapon enters its max charged state, immediately allowing it to use its Maximum profile.

profiles.name: Maximum
profiles.effect:
This weapon must attack using its current charge state profile.
When this weapon attacks using its Maximum profile, it immediately and entirely loses its charged state.
While attacking using this profile, this weapon performs a ranged attack.
This weapon may be used to overwatch 2/round.
profiles.on_attack: You also attack all characters in a Line between you and your target. You take 1 heat for each target attacked using this profile.

name: High Altitude Impact Launcher
description: A not-uncommon anti-air weapon favored by Gauss pilots and EDF licensees in general for their reliable nature. However, their intended role doesn't restrict them from anti-surface activity.
on_attack: If the target is flying, this weapon gains Reliable 3.

name: Dual Blaster Spears
description: A mechanical spear that rapidly stretches two spears at once to attack. While not as powerful as the average EDF weapon, it remains at the top of many EDF weapon lists for its simplicity and utility.
effect: When this weapon is fired, it attacks the same target up to twice. Only the first attack may benefit from bonus damage.
on_attack: You also attack all characters in a Line between you and your target. You take 1 heat for each target past the first.

name: Doomfall Lance
description: The Doomfall Lance is the current source of controversy between the EDF and the Union, being a disposable canister of condensed energy and a pump leading into a miniaturized Spritefall laser cannon. It is capable of being fired up to a mile away before losing energy to distance.

name: Storm Laser Array
description: A replica of a Dark Age weapon modified to be equipped within mech scale weapon mounts, even this model deals damage only imaginable by those who have wielded its power firsthand. It is capable of firing for nearly half a mile before its damage drops off.
effect: You may take more than two Storm Laser Arrays and the Storm Laser pilot weapon if you have access to it, however you may not take any other Exotic equipment if you do so.

name: FK4847 Gatling Gun
effect: This weapon cannot be fired normally. Instead, each time you perform a hostile action other than firing this weapon within this weapon’s range, you may attack that action’s target with this weapon as a free action. You take 2 heat at the end of each round you fire this weapon. This weapon cannot benefit from or consume lockon, nor can it benefit from systems or talents.

name: Lightning-Class AT Gun
description: The Lightning AT Gun, a precision tool for dealing with precision problems the EDF can't just use brute force or volume of fire to solve. While it's not a particularly heavy weapon, its slower fire rate lends it well to patient pilots who put proper care into each shot.
effect: If you haven't moved since the beginning of your last turn, including involuntary movement, the next attack with this weapon gains +1 accuracy and Threat equal to its Range.

name: Blossom-Class Assault Chain Launcher
description: A rapidly firing bazooka launcher capable of firing multiple rockets each second. While not individually destructive, these high-explosive rockets do devastating damage to mechs, vehicles, and other hostile forces.
on_hit: The target may drop prone. If it doesn't, it must succeed in an ENGINEERING save or become immobilized. On a success, it becomes impaired.

name: AC-190 Ballast-Class Breaker Rail Cannon
description: The Type-G (T(G)) line includes weapons from during their tenure under FirstComm, originally wielded by traditional combat vehicles from before the advent of combat mechs. While still relatively simple compared to the modern EDF armory, these were the pinnacle of complexity in their hay day. While they are relatively dated at this point, their title as USC, and now EDF, equipment is maintained for posterity.

name: Emerald Swarm Missile Array
description: The Type-A (T(A)) line includes weapons with their origins as Ranger and Gauss weapons. These tend to be kinetic or explosive to some degree, and are usually fairly simple and straight-forward weapons.

name: Flame Revolver
description: The Type-A (T(A)) line includes weapons with their origins as Ranger and Gauss weapons. These tend to be kinetic or explosive to some degree, and are usually fairly simple and straight-forward weapons.

name: Flame Revolver (Emitter)
description: The Type-A (T(A)) line includes weapons with their origins as Ranger and Gauss weapons. These tend to be kinetic or explosive to some degree, and are usually fairly simple and straight-forward weapons.
effect: You may only choose one type of Flame Revolver to equip.

name: Ptarmigan
description: The Type-A (T(A)) line includes weapons with their origins as Ranger and Gauss weapons. These tend to be kinetic or explosive to some degree, and are usually fairly simple and straight-forward weapons.

name: HI-5000 Plasma Mortar
description: The Type-B (T(B)) line includes weapons originally fielded by Commanders and Floaters. While progressively more radical in nature compared to T(A) weapons, these weapons still prove to be relatively simple, capable, and reliable in their own right. They do their thing to the best of their abilities.

name: HI-5000 Plasma Mortar (Emitter)
description: The Type-B (T(B)) line includes weapons originally fielded by Commanders and Floaters. While progressively more radical in nature compared to T(A) weapons, these weapons still prove to be relatively simple, capable, and reliable in their own right. They do their thing to the best of their abilities.
effect: You may only choose one type of HI-5000 Plasma Mortar to equip.

name: Model 9
description: The Type-B (T(B)) line includes weapons originally fielded by Commanders and Floaters. While progressively more radical in nature compared to T(A) weapons, these weapons still prove to be relatively simple, capable, and reliable in their own right. They do their thing to the best of their abilities.

name: "Tiny" Missile System
description: The Type-A (T(A)) line includes weapons with their origins as Ranger and Gauss weapons. These tend to be kinetic or explosive to some degree, and are usually fairly simple and straight-forward weapons.

name: "Typewriter" Heavy SMG
description: The Type-B (T(B)) line includes weapons originally fielded by Commanders and Floaters. While progressively more radical in nature compared to T(A) weapons, these weapons still prove to be relatively simple, capable, and reliable in their own right. They do their thing to the best of their abilities.

name: "Fish Eye" Rail Blaster
description: The Type-G (T(G)) line includes weapons from during their tenure under FirstComm, originally wielded by traditional combat vehicles from before the advent of combat mechs. While still relatively simple compared to the modern EDF armory, these were the pinnacle of complexity in their hay day. While they are relatively dated at this point, their title as USC, and now EDF, equipment is maintained for posterity.

name: Raijin Alpha
description: The Raijin Alpha is a naval assault weapon typically used by dedicated wing diver marines. The stress of using this weapon on a traditional chassis is catastrophic; yet, the EDF has been known to lend these apocalyptic weapons to certain dedicated EDF elites and veterans.
on_hit: The target immediately loses 1 Structure and rolls twice as many dice when rolling on the structure table until the start of their next turn. Then, you may perform a secondary attack against all targets within burst 1 of the target. These secondary attacks do not trigger additional secondary attacks.
on_attack: All Size 1 or smaller objects, Hard Cover, and terrain caught in this weapon’s area of effect are immediately Vaporized.
effect:
This weapon starts each combat unloaded.
You must either use a Core Point or take one Stress (and roll on the stress table afterwards) to fire this weapon. Regardless of which, you are also knocked Prone and cannot stand up until the end of your next turn.

name: "Peacemaker" Particle Accelerator Cannon
description: Thought to have led to the Vogel Team’s success suppressing their 500th terrorist attack, the Peacemaker is an immortalized and celebrated tool among EDF personnel and licensees across Union space. Its immense power output allows it to blast through cover and obstructions.
on_hit: The target cannot draw line of sight beyond adjacent spaces until the end of its next turn.

name: Twin Patriot
description: Developed for the EXO-48 Shakyas, the Twin Patriots are a set of dual autocannons that can be fit on to a single weapon mount. Though simple, they're reliable at what they do, and in recent times have been improved to have better anti-armour capability.

name: FLAM-270 Arc Melter
description: An evolution of the infantry-held FLAM-40 Incinerator, the FLAM-270 is a terrifying mech-scale weapon designed to melt through opposing mech's armour using weaponized electric arcs. Although it wasn't successful for it's original purpose, it still does well at overheating enemy mechs, forcing them to back off from direct conflict.

name: AC-150 Liberty
description: A distant descendant of the AC-22 Dum Dum, the Liberty is a hulking, reliable cannon made to take on whatever finds itself in front of its muzzle. Though not as flashy as some super-heavy weapons, the Liberty's cheap price tag and high stopping power have made it a favourite among simpler pilots, who appreciate consistent things that get the job done.
on_hit: The target must succeed on a Hull save or be knocked prone.

name: LAS-800 Claymore
description: Mounting a larger version of the laser technology used on the LAS-98, the LAS-800 Claymore is a terrifyingly flashy weapon that's loved by its pilots as much as it's loved by the public. Though cooling is something of an issue, many supporters of the weapon consider its gargantuan heat generation to be an acceptable downside in relation to its damage output.
effect: When using this weapon, keep a heat die, starting at 1 and maxing out at 3. Whenever you hit something, you deal Xd3 bonus energy damage where X is equal to the value of the die and take heat equal to the value on the die. Each turn you do not fire the Claymore lowers the heat die by 1. If the die is at 3 when you fire, you fire as normal, but the weapon's emergency heat dump canisters are ejected afterwards, resetting the die to 1. When the canisters are ejected, you must load new ones back into the Claymore as if it had the Loading tag before firing again.
on_attack: Increase the value of your heat die by 1.

name: MG-11 Minigun
description: An evolution of a classic, proven concept, the MG-11 is a staple of the HELLDIVERS™ mech arsenal, used when the typical GMS Assault Rifle or SSC Rail Rifle won't cut it. Though less reliable, it comes with superior firepower.

profiles.name: Standard
profiles.effect: You can spin up this weapon's barrels as a quick action.

actions.name: Spin Up MG-11
actions.detail: Spin up the barrels of the MG-11, Slowing your mech and allowing use of its "Spun Up" profile.

profiles.name: Spun Up
profiles.effect:
While spinning, you are slowed.
You can end this effect as a protocol.

actions.name: Cease Spin-Up
actions.detail: End the MG-11 Minigun's "Spun Up" profile, ending the Slowed condition and allowing the MG-11 Minigun to be used with its "Standard" profile.

name: MLS-148 Demolisher
description: A modified and heavily upscaled version of the MLS-4X Commando, the MLS-148 Demolisher is a mech-scale weapon designed to shred through infantry units that would otherwise prove troublesome for it's accompanying MG-11 Minigun. Though small, the system is relatively cheap.
effect: Against Biological targets, the MLS-148 Demolisher deals 4 bonus Explosive damage.

name: P-26 Mercy
on_crit: The target becomes Shredded until the end of the round. If they are already shredded, it isn't cleared until the end of their next turn.

name: MGX-420
description:
Effectively multiple MGX-42s strapped together to form a massive machine gun array, the MGX-420 is a mech-scale weapon capable of dumping it's entire ammo capacity into your mech faster than you can snicker at the numbering of its name. Like the original MGX-42, the MGX-420 is incapable of reloading, and instead easily clips into it's mount and is violently ejected forward out of the mount when its ammo is through. Fortunately, new MGX-420 drones can be easily called down from orbit, so running out of ammo is a firefight is never a major concern.
Though not equipped in the Byblos's stock loadout, many pilots prefer to license MGX-420s for their ability to suppress targets.
effect:
At the start of combat, regain all limited charges of this weapon.
When the MGX-420 uses all of its limited charges, it violently fires the weapon out of the mount, dealing 1 Kinetic damage to a Character of your choice within Range 5.

actions.name: Request Resupply
actions.detail: You call down a resupply drone, loading a new set of MGX-420s into your mech. You replenish all limited charges of all MGX-420s on one mount.

name: AR-32L Supremacy
effect: Against Shredded targets, this weapon instead deals 1d6+2 damage.

name: C-700 Smite
description: The C-700 Smite is a variable geometry canister launching coil-railgun hybrid that fires a variety of printed-in-gun munitions.

profiles.name: Single-Shot Slug
profiles.effect: You may fire this weapon using any profile.

profiles.name: Barrel
profiles.effect: You may fire this weapon using any profile.
profiles.on_attack: Place a Size 1 piece of hard cover between you and the target.

profiles.name: High Explosive Shell
profiles.effect: You may fire this weapon using any profile.

profiles.name: Illumination Shell
profiles.effect: You may fire this weapon using any profile.
profiles.on_attack: When firing with this profile, the affected area becomes covered in soft cover until the end of your next turn. Characters fully inside the area cannot draw line of sight outside of it.
